titleStmt.title: James H. Embry to James Harlan
CWG2764

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Richmond Ky
18th April 1862
Hon. James Harlan
Dr Sir --

I send you enclosed two copies of orders certifying the removal of Irvine A. Hunter & Cyrus B. Cook, late Magistrates, from their Districts. I send you also Petitions to the Governor asking the appointment of G. W. Ballew & S. D. Walker to supply the vacancy until the August Election.

I send the Papers to you as I know the matter will be attended to immediately, as the people wish to have the vacancies supplied, & our court of claims meets the first of next month & we wish the gentlemen suggested as members of the court -- They are among the very best men of our County.
Will you please see the Governor & ask him to commission the gentlemen named in the Petition --

Very truly
Yr. Friend
James H. Embry
